intro: Maihueniopsis camachoi, commonly known as the Andean sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments and thrives at high elevations. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
